body: i just run the oap first , the ui and agent have not run yet. i appear the exception, I will analyze the log carefully and check it to confirm the root of the problem.
List<RemoteClient> clients . i think these are agent client . is it alright ?

I know it needs size, aka list must not be empty. My question is, it should not be empty. If the cluster management works well. 

This pr tries to hide this exception, which actually should not happen. If need to merge this, we need to know, what is happenning?
ok. i understand.  i will check it why i happen this.

> List clients . i think these are agent client . is it alright ?

No. It isn't. That is my concern. You are misunderstanding the codes. That is client inside the oap server, connecting to another oap server.
I am going to close this. Let's continue discussions if you find more.

First of all, docker releases are not official releases. Just some ppmc make them available for convenient. And for 5.x, we even don't have those convenient release.
@JaredTan95 @hanahmily Could you explain the detail?
No. We wouldn't be conflict with your dependency. In agent jar, all classes under org.apache.skywalking.
That depends on your settings, I don't know. Does your oap server startup right, and listening at 127.0.0.1:10800? Only you know that.

In fact , i just install  for your guide without modifing anything configurations .
1 )Unzip the package
2) Change to 
`storage:
  h2:
    driver: org.h2.jdbcx.JdbcDataSource
    url: jdbc:h2:mem:skywalking-oap-db
    user: sa
` 
3)Only sh start.sh : it shows  successful
You need to check the logs. I don't know what happens at your env.
You should try it: https://github.com/apache/incubator-skywalking-docker/tree/master/6/6.0-beta/compose.
What is the status of this?

I agree we could provide separated settings, but I am not sure the way in your commits is good.

This is service discovery related issue, we should provide an optional setting in cluster implemention. Like in consul or zookeeper.

Add in core will make users confused.
Such as adding `exposeHost` in consul and zookeeper.
Another question, what lb requires localhost? And does this cause by some deployment way?
I left my comments and questions in issue.
Another reason I propose this is, in container cluster discovery implementation, this is harder to understand, such as k8s. Discovery is not the responsibility of core, right?

Why do you think this is a bug? Match count is part of the alarm system, to avoid false alarm in an unstable system. You coukd set the count to 1, if you don't want this.
fixed.
From the log, can't find the agent jar in your path. Do you add the agent to the target path?
Agent.jar is a jar file, not a elf format file. I am a little confused about this error. Do you set the java command right?

Hi Sheng,

Sorry its my bad that i  used JVM option -agentpath instead of -javaagent . I changed it and i could start the JVM without any issues

Sattish.
Thanks for the feedback.
The most likely, your under monitoring service vm have a different time or timezone settings with your browser. If it is docker, I assume UTC timezone, you could change timezone in time selector.

Hi Wu,

Thanks for the response. I could see few traces when i move ahead of time. But i am not able to drill down from the root transaction. It displays HTTP request took 1280 ms but not able to drill down from there. Have attached the snapshot. Is any config been not set in our agent

Sattish.
![screen shot 2019-02-11 at 12 22 27 pm](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7449241/52549206-0923ef00-2df8-11e9-93ce-90349a664f53.png)

What do you have in this HTTP request? Calling another RPC or database? 

Please read https://github.com/apache/incubator-skywalking/blob/master/docs/en/setup/service-agent/java-agent/README.md#supported-middlewares-frameworks-and-libraries to find out whether your RPC framework or db driver is supported?

If just Spring java bean, consider to use `Trace Spring beans` in [optional plugin](https://github.com/apache/incubator-skywalking/blob/master/docs/en/setup/service-agent/java-agent/README.md#optional-plugins)

Hi we are calling another remote REST API service. I believe they use resteasy template

resteasy templete is not in our supported list yet. You could follow [develop guide](https://github.com/apache/incubator-skywalking/blob/master/docs/en/setup/service-agent/java-agent/README.md#plugin-development-guide) to build a new plugin, and contribute to us.
Then you could dive in the trace.
Meanwhile, you could submit a new issue for `support resteasy`. Maybe others have interests to contribute too.

@hanahmily
```
# docker pull skywalking/oap
Using default tag: latest
latest: Pulling from skywalking/oap
Digest: sha256:1e3a411e7a3b02738e9651e1e323510c35a568e804f1bfc502f9600e9ff8ceb0
Status: Image is up to date for skywalking/oap:latest
```

```
# docker run -d --name sw skywalking/oap
# docker exec -it sw ls /
bin           lib           root          srv           usr
dev           media         run           sys           var
etc           mnt           sbin          tmp
home          proc          skywalking    trace-buffer
```

there is no directory `apache-skywalking-apm-incubating`
`skywalking/oap` is official release for stable version. `docker/docker-compose.yml` is related to `/docker/oap/Dockerfile`. I think @hanahmily give the right new name.
@wu-sheng ok i know,thank you anyway.
This issue, you should submit to protobuf or grpc, I don't think we can deal with it. Also I notice this issue just happens in protoc on Windows.
CI breaks because of wrong submodule binding. After #2239 merged, this should be fixed.

Replaced by #2244

In default setting, the register data like this
```
{"name":"remote","id":"1bd7fb14-22f7-40a4-ad87-e5b4c7d93fbe","address":"0.0.0.0","port":11800,"payload":{"address":{"host":"0.0.0.0","port":11800,"isSelf":true}},"registrationTimeUTC":1550036632697,"serviceType":"DYNAMIC","enabled":true}
```

Then I set the internal host/port
```
zookeeper:
  nameSpace: ${SW_NAMESPACE:""}
  hostPort: ${SW_CLUSTER_ZK_HOST_PORT:localhost:2181}
  #Retry Policy
  baseSleepTimeMs: ${SW_CLUSTER_ZK_SLEEP_TIME:1000} # initial amount of time to wait between retries
  maxRetries: ${SW_CLUSTER_ZK_MAX_RETRIES:3} # max number of times to retry
  internalComHost: 172.10.4.10
  internalComPort: 8080
```

The register info turns to
```
{"name":"remote","id":"f70d5e92-d104-48d6-9a45-2ae6babdb8f7","address":"172.10.4.10","port":8080,"payload":{"address":{"host":"172.10.4.10","port":8080,"isSelf":true}},"registrationTimeUTC":1550036761783,"serviceType":"DYNAMIC","enabled":true}
```

`address` and `port` changed.
